display_title.display_title:
Algérie – Quatrième projet
            routier : Algérie - Quatrième Projet routier

subtopic: Banks & Banking Reform,Business Environment,Airports and Air Services,Roads & Highways,Business in Development
teratopic: Private Sector Development,Transport,Finance and Financial Sector Development
admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourth Highway Project will assist
            Algeria in attaining its objectives in the highway subsector
            by improving overall road maintenance and training of
            maintenance personnel, reconstructing a section which is
            presently a serious bottleneck in the national network that
            could hamper regional development, improving the efficiency
            and productivity of the construction industry and helping
            develop a program to increase access in rural areas. The
            loan will finance: (i) the full foreign exchange cost of
            additional equipment for routine and light periodic
            maintenance within a second tranche of a five year
            maintenance program and training of maintenance personnel;
            (ii) 87 percent of the foreign cost of a second tranche of a
            long-term pavement strengthening program and the
            reconstruction of a 7 km section of the National Road 9 (NR
            9) between Bordj Mira and Kherrata; and (iii) 70 percent of
            the total of consultants services for construction
            supervision, training of public construction industry
            personnel and preparation of a project to improve the
            country's rural road network. Benefits include
            increased productivity of maintenance operations, reduction
            in transport costs and savings in road expenditures. Direct
            beneficiaries are road users and road maintenance authorities.
